description: Alpine Escape: Fresh mountain air, winding trails, cozy chalets — your soundtrack for Swiss summits.

items.name: The Eiger Trail
items.location_hint: Eigergletscher station or Kleine Scheidegg (Starting point)

items.name: Sentiero Cristallina
items.location_hint: Passo di Cristallina Ossasco, 6780 Airolo, Switzerland

items.name: Bachalpsee Lake
items.description: One of the top trails for hiking in Switzerland is the Bachalpsee Lake surrounded by lofty mountain-sides. Inclined in the Swiss Alps, the hike is short and offers an easy but leisurely sort of adventure. Surrounded by the epic mountain scape for the entire journey, you'll be stopping more often to take a sneak peek of the surroundings.

items.name: Wildhaus To Säntis
items.description: Wildhaus to Säntis is a point-to-point trail in the St. Gallen region of Switzerland. This trail offers you the most unique chance to watch some wildlife of the region. That's why it's considered one of the best hikes in Switzerland by some experts. Not just hiking, the trail is otherwise also popular for nature walks as the swarming lush green region is pretty too!

items.name: Saas Fee Hohenweg
items.description: The Saas Fee Hohenweg is one of the greatest but toughest trails for hiking in Switzerland. The challenging trail follows a mountainous route parallel to the western Saastal. The challenge is somewhat neutralised by the stunning views of the mountains that tower above the Bernese Alps and Saas Valley. You will reach a maximum elevation of 7, 945 ft. on your journey.

items.name: Bürgenstock Felsenweg
items.description: When you take this hike, you will understand how beautiful Switzerland is. It's like you are transported into a place where natural beauty has no limit. The Bürgenstock Felsenweg is one of the best best hikes in Switzerland, as considered by some experts and rightly so. It is a circular man-made trail whose construction took 5 years to complete. The hike ensures that you are greeted with beautiful views of the lake and mountains from all directions.

items.name: Uina Gorge Hike
items.description: The Uina Gorge Hike is a fascinating spot for hiking in Switzerland on the High Alpine trail. The Watles Valley is where you start your hike from and continue on the Schlinigtal valley high mountain trail. From there on, you are bombarded with mountains and hills almost to the end of your journey. The rocks of the gorge are pretty sturdy and hence good hiking shoes are recommended.

items.name: Five Lakes Walk
items.description: The Five Lakes Walk is an easy hike in the Zermatt region of Switzerland. Since you are in Zermatt, you will never forget those charming views of the Matterhorn and surrounding Alps mountains. As a result, the perfect combination of outdoor adventures and alpine scenery is what this hike offers. Gazing at the mountain up top and the astonishing lake down low are two wild sights on your journey. For this reason, many hikers rate this to be the best hikes in Switzerland.

items.name: Fuorn Pass To Lü
items.description: The Fuorn Pass is one of the prettiest Switzerland mountains and an ideal place for adventure enthusiasts. Passing the countless number of pine trees, you are also greeted with lakes, incredible valley views and several mountain peaks. Why else it gets added in the list of best places to hike in Switzerland is due to the journey's end in the ever-peaceful village called Lü.

items.name: Gastlosen Hike
items.description: The Gastlosen mountains are a chain of limestone mountains that resonate the looks of the Dolomites in Italy. The hike trail loops around these magnificent mountains with sweeping views of the forests and villages of Switzerland. The gorgeous hike is easy and mostly done as a loop. The Chalet du Soldat mountain cabin comes in the way of your hike so you can also catch a short break if you please. Overall, this is a great place to start hiking in Switzerland.

items.name: By Bus
items.description: Boarding a bus is beneficial if you wish to access the remote towns and smaller regions where there are no train stations. However, the bus stops are mostly close to one or the other train stations, and so if you wish to take a train afterwards, it becomes convenient.

items.name: By Train
items.description: Trains are considered to be one of the best mode, even by the locals. The train system in Switzerland is much developed with an access to multiple places in the country and has clean stations and offer a range of services. Rest assured, getting around in trains is fa more comfortable than any other mode of transport.

items.name: By Rental Car
items.description: Hiring a car through the agencies is much easier if you have an international driving permit and are at least 20 years of age. Keeping in mind the high cost of diesel or gasoline, this is not a preferred mode to get around the country. You can get a complimentary car in case you're staying in a high-end hotel with less or no charges.
